caption:
This photograph captures a scene on a serene body of water, possibly a river or a large lake, during what appears to be either early morning or before sunset, given the soft lighting. At the forefront of the image, two individuals are visible in a small motorboat that is in motion, creating a wake in the tranquil water. The person at the helm of the boat is standing and seems to be steering or controlling the motor, dressed in a casual outfit with a red cap. The second individual is seated towards the bow of the boat, wearing a yellow life jacket over dark clothing. The boat contains essential gear which might be for fishing or another similar outdoor activity, suggesting they are perhaps embarking on or returning from an excursion.

The environment is relatively calm, and the background features a faintly visible line of lush trees and a slightly clearer hilly outcrop, indicating a natural, scenic landscape with sparse human disturbance. The sky is hazy, adding a feeling of solitude and quiet to the setting. The overall mood conveyed is peaceful, focused on outdoor leisure activities in a tranquil natural setting. The photograph itself has an older, possibly vintage quality, seen in its grain and color saturation typical of film photography from earlier decades.
title: Crabbing in the waters around Blufton. This is a summer occupation for members of the black-owned oyster cooperative.
